node.title: Travis Scott Now Faces 12 Lawsuits Connected to 8 Deaths At Astroworld Performance
node.alt: Travis Scott is facing multiple lawsuits in connection with the tragedy at the Astroworld Music Festival. Pictured, Scott performs during 2021 Astroworld Festival at NRG Park on November 5, 2021 in Houston.
node.description: In one petition, a concertgoer claimed that Scott's show was a direct result of "a motivation for profit at the expense of concertgoers' health and safety."
node.content:
["Rapper Travis Scott is facing multiple lawsuits in connection to the deadly crowd incident that claimed eight lives and injured hundreds more during Scott's performance at the Astroworld Festival in Houston last Friday.", "As of Monday, at least 11 lawsuits have been filed against Scott and organizers of the festival, Live Nation Entertainment and ScoreMore, in Harris County District Court.", "In one petition filed over the weekend, concertgoer Manuel Souza sued Scott for the \"predictable and preventable tragedy\" that Souza claims was a direct result of \"a motivation for profit at the expense of concertgoers' health and safety,\" according to Billboard. He is seeking $1 million in damages.", "Another lawsuit has been filed against Scott and Canadian musician Drake, who appeared alongside Scott on stage for the headline set, for \"inciting mayhem.\"", "On Sunday, high-profile attorney Ben Crump also announced he was filing suit against Scott and Astroworld on behalf of 21-year-old concert attendee Noah Gutierrez.", "", "
Travis Scott is facing multiple lawsuits in connection with the tragedy at the Astroworld Music Festival. Pictured, Scott performs during 2021 Astroworld Festival at NRG Park on November 5, 2021 in Houston.
", "The fatal crowd crush occurred during the first night of Scott's two-day festival, which he started back in 2018. More than 50,000 people were in attendance at the NRG Park stadium complex of Scott's hometown.", "Houston police are still investigating the timeline of events, but details have begun to emerge about possible safety failures from the festival's organizers.", "Many have also pointed to Scott's past concert conduct, including one 2015 incident when the rapper was arrested after he encouraged fans to jump the barricades during his performance at Lollapalooza.", "This is a developing story and will be updated as more information becomes available."]
